data.title: [DOCS] Area/Area2D class ref update
data.body: Clean up language and make consistent across both nodes.

data.title: Deleted 2d nodes not removed completely from scene tree
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
On OpenSuse tumbleweed and Godot version 3.0.alpha.custom_build

**Issue description:**
Deleted 2d nodes in unsaved scene tree not completely removed and using object navigator buttons in inspector(< >) you can swich between removed objects. but after saving the scene, that objects removed completely.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1- Create a scene and add some nodes and one or more sprites.
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3175411/30780241-5b4a088c-a113-11e7-8577-661a71268dd7.png)
2- Delete nodes from scene tree.
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3175411/30780242-5b6ab5fa-a113-11e7-91bf-5585de187fc1.png)
3- Try to navigate over deleted nodes using < > buttons in inspector.

data.title: Add support for OpenSSL 1.1.0.
data.body:
This release hides many struct members which provides easier forward compatibility but is a break from previous releases. A few small macros provide compatibility between both 1.1.0 and 1.0.x.

Fixes #8624.

This PR builds against the builtin 1.0.2 and against Fedora's 1.1.0.

data.title: Enable building against system zstd.
CollisionObject shape owner indexing is inconsistent
data.body:
3.0 master

Shape owners added via `create_shape_owner()` start at id 1, but shapes added to those owners with `shape_owner_add_shape()` are indexed starting at 0.

I feel like shape owner ids should start at 0 as well. Am I wrong/missing something?

    create_shape_owner(self)
	print(get_shape_owners())  # prints [1]
	shape_owner_add_shape(1, CircleShape2D.new())
	print(shape_owner_get_shape(1, 0))  # the new circle shape

data.title: Fix possible infinite loop with bucket fill tool
data.body: Fixes #10262

data.title: Transparency turns off screen space reflections
data.body:
*Godot commit d3ea922

If I have a material that is set to be transparent, ss reflections aren't drawn on it.

[Example Project](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1326947/reflectionTransparency.zip)
![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1700581/30778023-f211ba40-a086-11e7-949c-34e21c10f6a1.png)
The materials used on both sides of the plane are identical except that one side has the Transparent Flag set.

data.title: Crash on Range.unshare() when Range isn't sharing to begin with.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Godot 3.0 master 2017-09-23 AppImage from https://dl.bintray.com/calinou/godot/

**Issue description:**
When calling unshare() on a Range from within GDScript, if the Range isn't already "sharing" the game crashes with no error message in the engine console. (But backtrace from terminal included below.)


**Steps to reproduce:**
Place something that inherits from Range in the scene (I've tried ScrollBars, ProgressBars etc...) then have a script call unshare() on it. Like this -> get_node("VScrollBar").unshare(). If .share(some_other_range) was not called on it previously, the game crashes. If the Range IS "sharing" with another range, calling .unshare() twice will cause it to crash. (First unshare will do what it's supposed to, second will crash it). I expect it to do nothing normally, I'm not sure what else it could do, but at least not crash.


**Link to minimal example project:**
Minimal example project. Hit run and it should show off the bug.
[scrollbug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1326937/scrollbug.zip)

Backtrace:
```handle_crash: Program crashed with signal 11
Dumping the backtrace. Please include this when reporting the bug on https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues
[1] /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x354b0) [0x7f09a69104b0] (??:0)
[2] Range::_unref_shared() (??:?)
[3] Range::_ref_shared(Range::Shared*) (??:?)
[4] MethodBind0::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) (??:?)
[5] Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) (??:?)
[6] Variant::call_ptr(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant*, Variant::CallError&) (??:?)
[7] GDFunction::call(GDInstance*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&, GDFunction::CallState*) (??:?)
[8] GDInstance::_ml_call_reversed(GDScript*, StringName const&, Variant const**, int) (??:?)
[9] Node::_notification(int) (??:?)
[10] Control::_notificationv(int, bool) (??:?)
[11] Object::notification(int, bool) (??:?)
[12] Node::_propagate_ready() (??:?)
[13] Node::_propagate_ready() (??:?)
[14] Node::_set_tree(SceneTree*) (??:?)
[15] SceneTree::init() (??:?)
[16] OS_X11::run() (??:?)
[17] /tmp/.mount_Godot-erDqss/usr/bin/godot(main+0xaf) [0x93f3bf] (??:?)
[18] /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xf0) [0x7f09a68fb830] (??:0)
[19] /tmp/.mount_Godot-erDqss/usr/bin/godot() [0x9405d0] (??:?)
-- END OF BACKTRACE --
```

data.title: KinematicBody keeps "jumping" with move_and_slide
data.body:
**Godot 3 master 18e453baf**

**Issue description:**
Using `move_and_slide` a KinematicBody will make it jump constantly even at the smallest separation margin, and a bit bigger safe margins do not seem to be working right, like if small are still too big.

This affects `is_on_floor` and also is noticeable on the visual nodes attached to the body (like meshes).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use `move_and_slide` and watch the body little jumps.
Or use `is_on_floor` and look at the intermittent true/false values.

![buggymove](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/30777176-79179632-a08b-11e7-8b37-29c289caad22.gif)


**Link to minimal example project:**
Can be seen in the Kinematic Character 3D demo.

data.title: Fix gcc lto
data.body:
This repairs LTO on X11 and adds it to MingW targets. The difference in
linktime is substantial, but runtime performance is quite a bit better.

data.title: Some more GDScript performance optimizations
data.body:
Two new changes to GDScript:
* On compilers that support computed goto use it to dispatch opcodes in GDScript::call()
* Remove several indexing checks on DEBUG_RELEASE, these shouldn't appear in released games.

And an optimization for safe_refcount:
* Allow better inlining of safe_refcount implementations. Not a huge win but very little effort and the effect is measurable.

Overall improvement is about 20% for the following GDScript
```gdscript
func _ready():
	var time_before = OS.get_ticks_msec()

	var c
	for i in range(10000000):
		var next 
		var first = 1
		var second = 2
		for c in range(40):
			next = first + second
			first = second
			second = next
		c = next
	print(c)

	var total_time = OS.get_ticks_msec() - time_before
	print("Time taken: " + str(total_time))
	get_tree().quit()
	pass
```

Regression testing has been done with 2d/platformer, 3d/platformer, goltorus, and this program.

data.title: Online Docs Member Variable descriptions not processed properly.
data.body:
Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
Tags like [code][/code] and [b][/b] or references to other classes and methods like [method _integrate_forces] aren't being converted and instead show up just you'd write them. Newlines also cause problems.

**Steps to reproduce:**
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_rigidbody.html
Scroll down to the continuous_cd member variable to see the issue with newlines, you'll also see [code]true[/code] there. By scanning through other member variables, you can see that [code][/code], [b][/b], and [method _integrate_forces] were not converted as they should.

This seems to affect the in engine docs too but not in the same way.

data.title: Allow to set a custom DynamicFont in editor settings
data.body:
Allows *.tres and *.res extensions to load custom interface font and custom text editor font.
Note: if the plan was to have the ability to choose a font directly (ttf, otf...) then in the meantime this PR allows to choose a font easily without recompiling the engine.

Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10866

Consolas
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30773995-40e6d700-a07c-11e7-93e1-78b09f034da8.png)

Old London
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30773993-3640f268-a07c-11e7-816f-557e735d1ab2.png)

data.title: Added skeleton x-ray
data.body:
I've added the x-ray on skeleton in order to see its bones. It can be activated in the Debug menu.

![untitled2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8342599/30773143-df7cb41e-a06a-11e7-9187-aed0247faeb7.png)

I'm not 100% sure that EditorNode is the right way where to put the variable debug_skeleton_xrays. Please let me know if I've to move it in a better place.

My intent was to add the skeleton bones names, but it require the creation of an additional Node that allow me to use a label in the 3D world. So for now I'm submitting only this.

Related topic: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/11507

data.title: Impossible to create transparent ViewportTexture with Sprite3D
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux, build 210ebb5cdbecd326c1b0edd35cfda94e3a74c6d9, gpu gtx1060

**Issue description:**
I was not able to create transparent Sprite3D viewport texture, for example to use Label in 3d environment. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create new scene.
2. Add `Viewport` node 
3. Add `Sprite3D` node
4. Inside `Sprite3D` node  'texture' property create 'new viewport texture', link it with `Viewport` node
5. Ensure 'Transparent' flag is set to true in `Sprite 3D`
6. In `Viewport` node ensure 'Transparent Bg' flag is set to true
7. In `Viewport` node ensure size is bigger than 0,0 (lets say 200x100)
7. Add `Label` node to Viewport node, fill in some text
8. Observe That background is opaque:
![viewport sprite3d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/30772666-6416fbcc-a060-11e7-9908-b8f68b6ac1f9.png)


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: confused about collision position and world_to_map
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04, Godot 2.1.4 stable

**Issue description:**
Collisions with tilemap should return which tile there was a collision with (through world_to_map and get_cellv, given the collision_pos
For collisions to the right everything seems to work that way, collisions to the left return the tile -1

**Steps to reproduce:**
See included sample project

**Link to minimal example project:**
[TilemapCollision.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1326394/TilemapCollision.zip)

Edit:
Adapted the title, it actually has nothing inconsistent about it, that was a bit rush but the results look confusing (to me, anyway).

An example in a more descriptive form:
The ball (circular collision shape) moves straight to the left, and eventually hits a tile of a tilemap, detected via is_colliding(), giving a collision position with an x value of 64.
The tile being hit (with x=0 for position) is 64 pixels wide (as is its matching rectangular collision shape), ranging from 0 to 63. 
Using world_to_map with that collision position then (correctly) returns [1, 7], but the tile that was hit is actually at [0,7], just left beside of it.

Moving the ball to the right works as expected, i get the right tile, there lies my confusion i guess.
To me it appears the collision position is slightly off, if it were to happen with an x value of 63 then the correct tile would be returned from world_to_map on that position.

Uncomment line 21 in main.gd to allow a small (simplistic) addition to the position to correct the ''straight left example', it does not solve all cases/angles though.

Perhaps i'm not completely completely understanding the inner workings and looked at it too long and missed it. I'm not getting the logic here. 

I can imagine to correct for some occurrences but that feels like not the way to go, perhaps it's a rounding issue that i'm not seeing.

This is from a gdscript point of view btw.

P.S.
Previous comment is obsolete

data.title: Loading a PNG bigger than 4096 causes image corruption
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3, Godot 2.1.4
Windows 10 64 bits

Loading an image with one dimension larger than 4096 causes corruption of the image.

As soon as the size is 4097 or higher, corruption appears:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30769093-631526ac-a012-11e7-908d-947627bfde84.png)

I couldn't reproduce it in 3.0 with s3tc and etc2 both disabled.

data.title: Selecting a sprite with big texture on it is very slow
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3, Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I just noticed that selecting a sprite having a big texture on it in the viewport freezes the editor for a second or two. On comparison, selecting a smaller sprite is instant, scaled or not. Selecting in the tree doesn't have this issue.
It's unclear to me why this would be so slow?

Repro:
1) Create a big PNG, like 4000x4000 or above
2) Assign it on a sprite (notice first freeze as you assign it, but it's because of a `load`)
3) Deselect anything
4) Now click on the sprite in the viewport: notice short freeze

data.title: Add an option to not override selected text color
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

I just found it would be useful to be able to NOT change text color to black when selecting it, because it would allow customizing a dark selection color without alterating initial text color and syntax highlighting.

Example of this in Sublime Text:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30767740-bb7df53e-9fff-11e7-9f4c-91fe8c2c125c.png)

The result in current Godot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30767766-1a8c74ce-a000-11e7-84e6-d5f778a44b0b.png)

data.title: Selection color makes documentation unreadable
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

Selecting text in a documentation file makes it unreadable. In comparison, script files are fine because text takes a dark color instead.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30767692-4234bf82-9fff-11e7-9f3c-87c389747f34.png)

Note: this other issue could become related https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/11502
